name: Grafana Access Automation and Dashboard backups.txt - Azure AD Sync with Grafana Teams
description: This section explains how Grafana allows synchronization between teams or groups from an authentication provider (like Azure AD, LDAP, or SAML) and teams within Grafana. This enables automatic addition or removal of users from specific Grafana teams based on their membership in the corresponding teams or groups in the authentication provider. It simplifies user management by keeping team memberships in sync across systems.
use_cases: Automatically add or remove users from Grafana teams based on their membership in corresponding teams/groups in the authentication provider (Azure AD, LDAP, SAML, etc.)
Streamline user management by keeping team memberships in sync across Grafana and the authentication provider
Ensure appropriate access and permissions for users in Grafana based on their roles or teams in the authentication provider
Simplify onboarding and offboarding processes by automatically updating Grafana team memberships based on changes in the authentication provider
capabilities: Synchronization between auth provider teams and Grafana teams
Automatic user addition/removal from Grafana teams
Support for LDAP, OAuth, and SAML auth providers

name: Grafana Access Automation and Dashboard backups.txt - Implementation
description: This section explains the implementation of two scheduled tasks (cronjobs) in the Grafana Access Automation and Dashboard Backups system. The first task, 'team_sync', synchronizes user accounts from Azure Active Directory (AD) groups to Grafana teams every hour, ensuring that new users added or removed from AD are reflected in Grafana. The second task, 'dashboard_backup', creates daily backups of all Grafana dashboards.
use_cases: Automated user provisioning and deprovisioning from Azure AD to Grafana
Centralized user management across Azure AD and Grafana
Regular backup of Grafana dashboards for data protection and recovery
